definition: relative darkness or lightness of a color, estimate the value of
details:
noun
- relative darkness or lightness of a color
= example: relative darkness or lightness of a color
- the quality (positive or negative) that renders something desirable or valuable
= example: the quality (positive or negative) that renders something desirable or valuable
- a numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed
= example: a numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed
- an ideal accepted by some individual or group
= example: an ideal accepted by some individual or group
- the amount of money, goods, or services that is considered to be a fair equivalent for something else
= example: the amount of money, goods, or services that is considered to be a fair equivalent for something else
= synonyms: economic value
- (music) the relative duration of a musical note
= synonyms: time value, note value
verb
- estimate the value of
= synonyms: rate, interpolate, extrapolate
- evaluate or estimate the nature, quality, ability, extent, or significance of
= synonyms: measure
- regard highly
= synonyms: respect
- fix or determine the value of
= example: fix or determine the value of
- hold dear
= synonyms: prize
